abstracts.cdata!:
The Community Development Project (CDP)
            for Bosnia and Herzegovina will improve basic services and
            facilities for low-income and poor communities in
            under-served municipalities, as well as improve the
            governance, and capacity of local governments, in the
            delivery of services. This environmental assessment document
            evaluated impacts as follows : protection of physical,
            biological and social environment; governance and capacity
            of local municipal governments; basic services  and
            facilities in low income and poor communities; operational
            relationships between CDP, municipalities, and local
            communities, relevant ministries, local consultants and
            contractors; site location; existing infrastructures;
            storage of materials and equipment; solid waste disposal. As
            a result of this assessment the EA suggest mitigation
            measures, as follows : construction debris will be
            transported prior to approved permission to use chosen dump
            site; promote; municipalities will develop jointly with PIU,
            financial and operation action plan (FOAP) a plan will
            include maintenance of rehabilitated infrastructure as a key
            issue for sustainability; develop a community action plan
            (CAP) to find resources within the community, and if it can
            not be found within the community, external resources will
            be identified; local consultants will be hired to perform
            social and institutional assessments of participants
            government agencies; to promote CDP activities at the state
            level, CDP can announce advertisement in newspapers, and
            broadcast announcements on radio and television; follow the
            Operational Manual's priority eligibility criteria for
            selecting Municipalities; and finally facilitate discussion
            with community members, local government agencies on general
            meetings to give a chance to everyone to express thoughts
            and ideas, throughout implementation of the project.
